DataElement.preferredName: Time Interval From Blood Specimen Collection To Freezing Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The period of time from blood specimen collection to freezing, measured in hours and minutes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Time Interval From Blood Specimen Collection To Freezing
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The period of time between two dates or events or between the beginning and end of something._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._A small volume of blood removed for testing or storage._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The period of time between two dates or events or between the beginning and end of something.

Concepts.definition: The period of time between two dates or events or between the beginning and end of something.

Property.preferredName: From Blood Sample Collection To Freezing
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.:A small volume of blood removed for testing or storage.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
A small volume of blood removed for testing or storage.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase when the temperature is lowered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
